snippet: Apple is expected to introduce mobile apps that will track a user’s health and fitness routine, and smart home devices, at its annual Worldwide Developers’ Conference.
abstract: Apple plans to introduce new health-tracking app at its annual Worldwide Developers' Conference, which will track statistics for health or fitness; company is also expected to make announcement about its efforts with connecting to so-called smart home devices, or home appliances that can be wirelessly controlled with a smartphone.
lead_paragraph: Apple is expected to introduce mobile apps that will track a user’s health and fitness routine, and smart home devices, at its annual Worldwide Developers’ Conference.

headline.main: At WWDC, Apple Is Set to Make Push Into Monitoring Health and Home
headline.print_headline: Apple Is Set to Make a Bigger Push Into Monitoring Health and Home
